Alípio, a journalist by profession, was a revolutionary militant history, having taken part of the peasant alloys, popular action (AP) and the PRT (Revolutionary Workers Party). Arrested, he was tortured and resisted the seviciousness, triumphing about his tormentors and reporting these events in the book "Resist is Precise." Alípio was also a member of the editorial board of and (in memoriam) and president of honor of poor peasants (LCP).

The book will be released inApril 25 in the political act called by the newspaper A New Democracyunder the motto“Neither forget nor appease: condemn the military coup yesterday and today!”, which will occur in Rio de Janeiro.

About the book

How to resist in the face of a hard combat? How to overcome jail? How to raise the revolutionary flag at the darkest moments? These questions that are commonly raised by true Democrats, when dealing with one of the bloodiest periods in our history, are answered through the great example of Alipio de Freitas.

The revolutionary trajectory of Alipio de Freitas, tireless militant of the cause of liberation of peoples, and their resistance in the jails of the military-fascist regime in Brazil are registered in resisting it is accurate, a book of his mining that had the first edition published in 1981.

Alipio played a highlighted role in the direction of the peasant alloys in the 1960s, performing the task of political instructor, occupying the general secretary of his organization. After the 1964 military-fascist coup, he moves to clandestinity, and is fully dedicated to the revolutionary peasant struggle.

Persecuted, he exiled in Mexico and then headed to Cuba, where he held courses in political and military formation and prepared his return to Brazil to continue the revolutionary struggle.

In 1970 he is arrested by the green-fashionwater regime. It spends almost ten years imprisoned in different arrests, facing and resisting the most brutal torture. Without ever folding, he defeated his tormentors. His memories of resistance in jails were recorded alive in the book “Resist is Precise”.

Their memory and legacy, in turn, continue to be honored by those who now wield their flag. As the National Commission on the Poor Peasants (LCP) pointed out, in a message to Guadalupe Magalhães, tireless and inseparable companion of Alípio de Freitas: “We will always honor our president of honor, raise his name, realize the dream by which he so much fought. ”
